> <OLD>

> "If you want to catch him then the surprice factor is esencial"replie

> relationship with the his most hatest enemie also for her unusual spark. My

> <OLD>
>
> Tucson nodds. Elita's protection was just as imperative as her mothers.
>
> "You're right Perceptor. But the final decision should be up to Rodimus. Of
> course, if I were Elita's father, I'd agree to it readilly."

<NEW>

Rodimus looked over at Tuscon, not quite sure what to make of that
comment. For one person to say what they would do in another's
situation is almost like to telling them they should do it, and to not
do it is unreasonable. Who is any one to tell a parent how to raise or
protect thier children, especially one who is not a parent?

Putting that thought off for the moment he turned to Perceptor, "What
do you mean this stealth program that would allow her to hide her
signature and even change it?" There was a definite note of concern in
his voice. "It can't be that easy to just switch signatures back and
forth, if it were, wouldn't we would all be doing it?" He frowned
wondering just how Perceptor was going to come up with all of this. He
respected Perceptor as a scientist, but he was also protective of his
daughter.

Meanwhile in the background Legacy watched Perceptor, his single optic
focused on the ex-Predacon, his thoughts are unknown, hidden as they
were behind his cold unmoving faceplate.

(TAG)

Preston
